title: CycloneDX Perspective Model
$comment: OWASP CycloneDX is an Ecma International standard (ECMA-424) developed in collaboration between the OWASP Foundation and Ecma Technical Committee 54 (TC54). The standard is published under a royalty-free patent policy. This JSON schema is the reference implementation and is licensed under the Apache License 2.0.

perspectives.title: Perspectives
perspectives.description: Defines domain-specific views into the document, enabling different audiences to interpret and navigate the data through their own conceptual lens. Each perspective identifies relevant data types and may provide domain-specific terminology mappings.

perspective.title: Perspective
perspective.description: A domain-specific view that identifies the types of data relevant to a particular audience and provides optional terminology mappings to facilitate interpretation. Perspectives enable tooling to generate filtered views, translate terminology, and validate document completeness against audience-specific requirements.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description:
An identifier that can be used to reference this perspective elsewhere in the document. Every `bom-ref` shall be unique within the document.
Value SHOULD NOT start with the BOM-Link intro 'urn:cdx:' to avoid conflicts with BOM-Links.

name.title: Perspective Name
name.description: The name of the perspective, typically indicating the target audience or domain.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the perspective, its intended audience, and the use cases it supports.

domains.title: Domains
domains.description: The domains or disciplines to which this perspective applies. Allows selection of multiple pre-defined domains, custom domains, or a combination of both.

mappings.title: Data Type Mappings
mappings.description: An array of mappings that identify the types of data relevant to this perspective using path expressions. Each mapping may include domain-specific terminology.

externalReferences.title: External References
externalReferences.description: References to external resources that provide additional context for the perspective, such as domain-specific standards, guidelines, or documentation.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Provides the ability to document properties in a name-value store. This provides flexibility to include data not officially supported in the standard without needing to use additional namespaces or create extensions.

perspectiveMapping.title: Perspective Mapping
perspectiveMapping.description: Maps a path expression to domain-specific terminology, enabling audiences to interpret CycloneDX data using familiar nomenclature. Each mapping identifies a data type within the document structure and may provide alternative names and descriptions used by the target audience.

expression.title: Path Expression
expression.description:
A path expression that identifies the types of data relevant to this perspective. The expression syntax shall conform to the format of the document's serialisation.
Use [JSONPath](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9535) for JSON, [XPath](https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath/) for XML, and default to JSONPath for Protocol Buffers unless otherwise specified.
Expressions select data types within the document structure, not specific field values.

nativeName.title: Native Name
nativeName.description: The domain-specific term used by the target audience to describe the data identified by the expression.

nativeDescription.title: Native Description
nativeDescription.description: A domain-specific description of the data type, explaining its significance within the context of the perspective.

relevance.title: Relevance
relevance.description: Indicates the importance of this data type to the perspective.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Describes the importance of a field in relation to other fields. Values shall be between 0.0 and 1.0. This allows for relative ranking of mappings, where higher values indicate greater importance.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: Explains why this data type is relevant to the perspective and how it should be interpreted or used.

perspectiveDomainChoice.title: Perspective Domain Choice
perspectiveDomainChoice.description: Allows selection of a pre-defined domain or specification of a custom domain.

name.title: Domain Name
name.description: The name of the custom domain.

description.title: Domain Description
description.description: A description of the custom domain, its scope, and the concerns it addresses.

preDefinedPerspectiveDomain.title: Pre-Defined Perspective Domain
preDefinedPerspectiveDomain.description: A pre-defined domain or discipline to which a perspective applies. Domains span security disciplines, safety engineering, industry verticals, technology areas, compliance frameworks, and cross-cutting concerns.

meta:enum.application-security: Security concerns related to software applications, including vulnerabilities, secure coding practices, input validation, and dependency management.
meta:enum.cloud-security: Security concerns specific to cloud computing environments, including configuration, identity management, data protection, and shared responsibility models.
meta:enum.container-security: Security concerns related to containerised applications, including image provenance, runtime protection, orchestration security, and supply chain integrity.
meta:enum.cryptographic-security: Concerns related to cryptographic implementations, algorithm selection, key management, certificate handling, and post-quantum cryptography readiness.
meta:enum.cyber-security: Broad security concerns encompassing threat detection, incident response, security operations, and defence-in-depth strategies.
meta:enum.data-security: Concerns related to protecting data at rest, in transit, and in use, including encryption, access controls, and data loss prevention.
meta:enum.endpoint-security: Security concerns for end-user devices including workstations, mobile devices, and peripherals, encompassing malware protection and device management.
meta:enum.firmware-security: Security concerns specific to firmware, including secure boot, firmware updates, integrity verification, and protection against persistent threats.
meta:enum.hardware-security: Security concerns related to physical hardware, including trusted platform modules, hardware security modules, side-channel attacks, and tamper resistance.
meta:enum.identity-access-management: Concerns related to authentication, authorisation, identity lifecycle management, privileged access, and zero-trust architectures.
meta:enum.network-security: Security concerns related to network infrastructure, including firewalls, intrusion detection, segmentation, and secure communications.
meta:enum.operational-security: Security concerns related to the deployment, configuration, and day-to-day operation of systems in production environments.
meta:enum.physical-security: Security concerns related to physical access controls, environmental protections, surveillance, and tamper evidence.
meta:enum.supply-chain-security: Concerns related to the security, integrity, and trustworthiness of components, vendors, and processes throughout the supply chain.
meta:enum.web-security: Security concerns specific to web applications and services, including OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, API security, and client-side protections.
meta:enum.automotive-safety: Safety concerns for automotive systems aligned with ISO 26262, including hazard analysis, functional safety requirements, and ASIL classifications.
meta:enum.aviation-safety: Safety concerns for aviation systems aligned with DO-178C, DO-254, and DO-326A, including design assurance levels and airworthiness requirements.
meta:enum.environmental-safety: Concerns related to environmental protection, hazardous materials handling, emissions, and ecological impact assessment.
meta:enum.functional-safety: Safety concerns aligned with IEC 61508 and derivative standards, focusing on systematic failures, safety integrity levels, and risk reduction.
meta:enum.machinery-safety: Safety concerns for industrial machinery aligned with ISO 12100 and IEC 62443, including safeguarding, emergency stops, and risk assessment.
meta:enum.maritime-safety: Safety concerns for maritime and offshore systems, including vessel automation, navigation systems, and compliance with maritime regulations.
meta:enum.nuclear-safety: Safety concerns for nuclear facilities and systems, including defence-in-depth, safety classification, and regulatory compliance with nuclear standards.
meta:enum.patient-safety: Safety concerns for medical devices and healthcare systems focusing on preventing harm to patients, including adverse event prevention and clinical risk management.
meta:enum.process-safety: Safety concerns for industrial processes involving hazardous materials, including process hazard analysis, safety instrumented systems, and layers of protection.
meta:enum.railway-safety: Safety concerns for railway systems aligned with EN 50126, EN 50128, and EN 50129, including signalling, train control, and safety cases.
meta:enum.aerospace-defense: Concerns specific to aerospace and defence industries, including mission-critical systems, military standards, and classified information handling.
meta:enum.automotive: Industry-specific concerns for automotive manufacturers and suppliers, including ISO/SAE 21434 cyber security and vehicle type approval.
meta:enum.building-automation: Concerns related to building management systems, HVAC controls, access systems, and smart building infrastructure.
meta:enum.consumer-electronics: Concerns specific to consumer electronic devices, including product safety, electromagnetic compatibility, and consumer protection regulations.
meta:enum.critical-infrastructure: Concerns related to systems designated as critical infrastructure, including sector-specific requirements and national security considerations.
meta:enum.education: Concerns specific to educational institutions and EdTech, including student data protection, FERPA compliance, and academic integrity.
meta:enum.energy-utilities: Concerns specific to energy and utility sectors, including NERC CIP compliance, grid security, and operational continuity.
meta:enum.financial-services: Concerns specific to financial institutions, including PCI DSS, SOX compliance, fraud prevention, and transaction integrity.
meta:enum.government: Concerns specific to government agencies and contractors, including FedRAMP, FISMA, and public sector procurement requirements.
meta:enum.healthcare: Concerns specific to healthcare organisations, including HIPAA compliance, electronic health records, and healthcare interoperability.
meta:enum.insurance: Concerns specific to insurance industry, including actuarial data integrity, claims processing security, and regulatory compliance.
meta:enum.legal: Concerns specific to legal industry, including attorney-client privilege, e-discovery, and legal hold requirements.
meta:enum.manufacturing: Concerns specific to manufacturing environments, including production systems, quality management, and shop floor security.
meta:enum.media-entertainment: Concerns specific to media and entertainment, including digital rights management, content protection, and broadcast systems.
meta:enum.pharmaceuticals: Concerns specific to pharmaceutical industry, including FDA 21 CFR Part 11, GxP compliance, and drug safety systems.
meta:enum.retail: Concerns specific to retail industry, including point-of-sale security, e-commerce platforms, and customer data protection.
meta:enum.telecommunications: Concerns specific to telecommunications providers, including network infrastructure, subscriber data, and regulatory compliance.
meta:enum.transportation: Concerns related to transportation systems beyond automotive and rail, including logistics, fleet management, and traffic control systems.
meta:enum.artificial-intelligence: Concerns related to AI systems, including model transparency, algorithmic bias, explainability, and ethical considerations.
meta:enum.edge-computing: Concerns specific to edge computing deployments, including distributed processing, local data handling, and remote device management.
meta:enum.embedded-systems: Concerns specific to embedded systems development, including real-time constraints, resource limitations, and hardware-software integration.
meta:enum.industrial-control-systems: Concerns specific to ICS environments, including PLCs, DCS, and industrial automation security aligned with IEC 62443.
meta:enum.industrial-iot: Concerns specific to Industrial Internet of Things deployments, combining IT security with OT requirements and industrial protocols.
meta:enum.internet-of-things: Concerns related to IoT devices and ecosystems, including device security, communication protocols, and fleet management.
meta:enum.machine-learning: Concerns specific to ML models, including training data provenance, model lineage, performance metrics, and reproducibility.
meta:enum.medical-devices: Concerns specific to medical device development aligned with IEC 62304, FDA guidance, and MDR/IVDR requirements.
meta:enum.mobile: Concerns specific to mobile applications and devices, including app store requirements, mobile-specific vulnerabilities, and device management.
meta:enum.operational-technology: Concerns specific to OT environments, bridging IT and industrial systems with focus on availability, safety, and legacy system integration.
meta:enum.robotics: Concerns specific to robotic systems, including autonomous operation, human-robot interaction safety, and motion control security.
meta:enum.scada: Concerns specific to Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems, including remote monitoring, control system security, and protocol vulnerabilities.
meta:enum.smart-grid: Concerns specific to smart grid infrastructure, including advanced metering, grid automation, and distributed energy resource management.
meta:enum.data-protection: Concerns related to data protection regulations such as GDPR, CCPA, and cross-border data transfer requirements.
meta:enum.export-control: Concerns related to export control regulations, including EAR, ITAR, and dual-use technology restrictions.
meta:enum.intellectual-property: Concerns related to patents, trade secrets, copyright, and other intellectual property rights and protections.
meta:enum.legal-compliance: Regulatory and legal requirements, including contractual obligations, liability considerations, and legal holds.
meta:enum.licensing: Concerns related to software licensing, licence compatibility, open source obligations, and commercial licensing terms.
meta:enum.privacy: Concerns related to personal data protection, privacy by design, consent management, and individual rights.
meta:enum.regulatory-compliance: Concerns related to compliance with industry-specific regulations, standards, and certification requirements.
meta:enum.maintainability: Concerns related to the ease of maintaining, updating, and supporting software and systems over their lifecycle.
meta:enum.performance: Concerns related to system performance, scalability, response times, and resource utilisation.
meta:enum.quality-assurance: Concerns related to testing, validation, verification, and overall quality metrics and processes.
meta:enum.reliability: Concerns related to system reliability, fault tolerance, mean time between failures, and degradation modes.
meta:enum.testability: Concerns related to the ability to test components and systems, including test coverage, test automation, and test data management.
meta:enum.incident-response: Concerns related to detecting, responding to, and recovering from security incidents and breaches.
meta:enum.penetration-testing: Concerns related to authorised security testing, vulnerability assessment, and security validation activities.
meta:enum.red-team: Concerns related to adversarial simulation, attack path analysis, and security control effectiveness testing.
meta:enum.risk-management: Concerns related to risk identification, assessment, treatment, and ongoing risk monitoring.
meta:enum.threat-intelligence: Concerns related to threat actor analysis, indicators of compromise, and proactive threat hunting.
meta:enum.threat-modeling: Concerns related to identifying weaknesses, threats, countermeasures, attack surfaces, and trust boundaries.
meta:enum.vulnerability-management: Concerns related to vulnerability identification, prioritisation, remediation tracking, and disclosure processes.
meta:enum.accessibility: Concerns related to ensuring systems are usable by people with disabilities, including WCAG compliance.
meta:enum.ethics: Concerns related to ethical considerations in technology development, including algorithmic fairness and responsible innovation.
meta:enum.human-factors: Concerns related to human-system interaction, usability, operator error prevention, and ergonomic design.
meta:enum.interoperability: Concerns related to the ability of systems to exchange and use information effectively across boundaries.
meta:enum.resilience: Concerns related to system resilience, business continuity, disaster recovery, and graceful degradation.
meta:enum.sustainability: Concerns related to environmental sustainability, energy efficiency, and responsible resource consumption.
meta:enum.transparency: Concerns related to openness, auditability, and the ability for stakeholders to understand system behaviour and composition.

perspectiveRelevance.title: Perspective Relevance
perspectiveRelevance.description: Indicates the importance of a data type to a perspective.

meta:enum.required: This data type is essential for the perspective and should always be present.
meta:enum.recommended: This data type is highly relevant and should be included when available.
meta:enum.optional: This data type provides supplementary information that may be useful.
meta:enum.informative: This data type provides background context but is not directly actionable.
